links.title: UMBC Counseling Center
links.desc: Retriever Integrated Health (RIH) supports students mental and emotional well-being through counseling and resources for issues like anxiety, academics, and relationships. Schedule a 20-minute consultation in person, by calling 410-455-2542, or online via myRetrieverCare.

links.title: myRetrieverCare
links.desc: myRetrieverCare is an online portal for students to access health and counseling services, schedule appointments, and manage their health information.

links.title: UMBC Emergency Crisis and After Hours Care
links.desc: UMBC's emergency campus mental health resources. This includes information on how to access emergency care and after-hours support.

links.title: Residential Life
links.desc: Residential Life provides on-campus housing, support, and resources for students living in UMBC residence halls.

links.title: Office of Equity and Inclusion
links.desc: The OEI promotes diversity, equity, and inclusion at UMBC through programs, training, and resources.

links.title: Womens Center
links.desc: The Womens Center at UMBC provides a safe space for students to engage in discussions, workshops, and events related. All are welcome, with respect for women, their experiences, and their potential.

links.title: i3b - Initiatives for Identity, Inclusion & Belonging
links.desc: i3B is a UMBC initiative that promotes identity, inclusion, and belonging through programs, events, and resources for students.

links.title: Calm
links.desc: A meditation and mindfulness app designed to support mental well-being. It offers guided meditations, sleep stories, breathing exercises, relaxing music, and classes to help users manage stress, improve focus, and sleep better.

links.title: Headspace
links.desc: A mobile app offering guided meditations, mindfulness exercises, and mental health support. It helps users reduce stress, improve focus, and enhance sleep through features like sleepcasts, daily meditations, and personalized coaching.

links.title: Insight Timer
links.desc: A free app and website offering guided meditations, music, expert talks, and mindfulness courses to support stress relief, sleep, and well-being. It features yoga classes, mood tracking, and discussion groups, making mindfulness accessible to all.

links.title: Welltrack Boost
links.desc: Welltrack Boost is a self-help app that provides resources and tools for mental health and wellness.

links.title: On Campus Events
links.desc: A list of events happening on the UMBC campus, including workshops, lectures, and social gatherings.

links.title: Health Promotion Events
links.desc: Health Promotion hosts events and workshops on topics related to health and wellness, including stress management, nutrition, and sexual health.

links.title: Togetherall
links.desc: Togetherall is an online community for students to connect, share experiences, and support each other in a safe and anonymous environment.

links.title: studywithme.io
links.desc: A platform for students to study together online, share study tips, and stay motivated.

links.title: Habitica
links.desc: Habitica is a habit-building and productivity app that gamifies your tasks and goals.

links.title: Notion
links.desc: Notion is an all-in-one workspace for note-taking, project management, and collaboration.

links.title: Finch
links.desc: Finch is a productivity app that helps you stay focused and organized with tasks, reminders, and goals.

links.title: UMBC Emergency Crisis and After Hours Care
links.desc: UMBC's emergency campus mental health resources. This includes information on how to access emergency care and after-hours support.

links.title: 988 Lifeline
links.desc: The 988 Lifeline is a 24/7 crisis hotline for individuals in the United States. It provides free and confidential support for people in distress, prevention, and crisis resources.

links.title: Campus Police
links.desc: UMBC Campus Police is available 24/7 for emergency situations. Call number 410-455-5555 or 911 for immediate assistance, to report a crime, or for a safety escort.
